newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's premier hotel to bill in dollars.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's premier hotel to bill in dollars.

text.p: Cape Town's landmark Mount Nelson Hotel will bill all guests in dollars from next year rather than in the unstable South African rand, the owners said on Friday.

"Obviously the fluctuating rand exchange rates have been a factor and we feel this decision will provide a stable rate to our international tour operators, travel agents and suppliers," hotel owner Orient-Express Hotels said.
The company added that the decision to introduce dollar-denominated room rates was in line with the practice of a large number of hotels worldwide.
"Orient-Express continues to look to develop the southern African arm of its collection and with a stable U.S. dollar rate we can provide a long term view to shareholders and clients alike," it said.

The South African rand has lost a third of its value against the dollar since a currency crisis in February sparked by fears over President Nelson Mandela's health and rumours of an imminent deregulation of foreign exchange controls.
